reviews.review: Can't quickscope

"Half-Life" is one of those classic games that you appreciate and say "wow, this is really good so far/game!"

Tell you the truth, I usually replay this game because it is unique in it's design and plot; no argument there and hands down.
... Знаю все одфаги пидары, но я всё ровно буду в ниё играть и любить до самой смерти

Building upon Half-Life’s genre I can say with confidence that people that come from the FPS genres or puzzle solving genres will love the game. I feel that players can relate to the game as not through the character, but the dividing choices Gordon has to make throughout Black Mesa. You never feel trapped in one specific area and it’s always a sense of progression through the game, this is a game that if people master the mechanics the ability to blaze right through the game blends for a satisfying experience which is the most enjoyable of all. 
Unfortunately there is no Character development as our character is mute, and we are never even shown his face in-game (excluding the box art and title screen). Gordon Freeman is supposed to represent the player, he is a shell that is controlled by the actions of the player and when you play Half-Life, you become Gordon Freeman.
For my passion of this old, retro game, I love to press that play button on my steam client and play a couple levels before I go do something else, Half-Life is a game that will never leave my heart and for that I have to give this game an honest 95% as I see the only downside is the graphical limitations of this wonderful game!

This game's difficulty levels are a pain in the ass compared to Half-Life 2, HL2: Ep 1, and MAYBE Ep: 2 (Episode 2 was also hard on hard difficulty) but Half-Life 1 takes the difficulty to another level, not on ANY playthrough of any of the Half-Life 2 games have I raged so hard that I nearly broke my keyboard, as this game did.

I do enjoy HL2 more, the story, gameplay and everything but this game is pretty amazing for a game from 1998.


It is VERY challenging if you go straight to hard mode, which is what I did after not playing it for like a year, and I regret my decision, I died at the Nihilanth like 30 fucking times that I had to take an hour long break.

Good game though.

A great game, albeit an often confusing and difficult one. I first tried it on hard mode, but after failing numerous times, I'm gonna give normal mode a try, first. I'd recommend the same for new players.

Aqui tenemos al denominado por muchas fuentes oficiales como "el juego del siglo". lanzado en 1998 half-life marco un antes y un despues con los juegos de genero shooter, a casi 20 años de ser publicado sigue siendo uno de los juegos de single-player con la historia mas original  y amada por los jugadores.

Relata la historia de Freeman un cientifico que trabaja para black mesa y tiene implicancias directas con los eventos que ocurren.

Graficamente marco un hito, inclusive en dias modernos existe una amplia variedad de mods y texturas para rejugarlo.

La jugabilidad es dinamica, rapida y al mismo tiempo precisa.

Dificultad: en lo personal la dificultad dificil es un reto pero por la siguentes razones, aqui es una mezcla de falta de munición, enemigos con buena punteria y reacción y falta de curación sumandole los puzzles que te hacen pensar de tanto en tanto en como superar una zona.

Recomiendo jugar este juegazo antes de pasarse al 2 o inclusive jugar al black mesa (la remasterizacion fan-made de half life)
Para mi el mejor juego shooter de mi infancia. considerando todas las veces que lo complete (al menos 6 con el disco original) puedo decir que si bien tiene una historia lineal, nunca deja de ser un clásico y bien merecido ganador de imnunerables premios. si no has jugado este juego no pierdas tiempo y consiguelo.

Un juego FPS muy interesante, adictivo, con buenos gráficos para la época, con una historia perturbadora y con enemigos muy dificiles.

Muy Recomendado!!

故事开始于黑山C区的实验事故，一条与Xen相连的通道被打开扩大，使得Xen上大量充满敌意的生物被传送至地球，对人类展开厮杀。

Everything that can be said about this game has been said, but the most important question would be, does the game still hold its own to this day? To this my response would be, “more than you’d expect”.

Initially, I was lured back to the series after “Epistle 3 Leaks”. While I anticipated a mediocre trip aided by my nostalgia goggles, I was pleasantly surprised by how well the title aged, like fine wine that tasted better over time. There are several reasons to why I derived to this conclusion, allow me to convey each in description below.

Firstly, the GoldSrc engine might be a bit dated graphically, but it is good enough to represent whatever model it needs within the game play, delivering good performances with smooth animation. You will come to appreciate how detailed the models for each entity are, despite their low polygon count. Comparing to the games today, you will noticed just how much work was put into optimisation, along with full on compatibility with a range of operating systems. Something I wish I could say the same for the developers today.

Secondly, the plot of Half Life was well written by Marc Laidlaw, it is just as good today as it was back in the yesteryear. You will be drawn in by the dubious stance of Black Mesa in its teleportation research, its lack of care in human resources as well as ethics. As well as the mysterious Xen forces and Nihilanth’s motive in invading Earth. The enigma that is G-Man still puzzles us to this day in who exactly he works for.

Thirdly, the AI technology in this game is just phenomenal. Marines would work in concert with one another, putting down suppressing fire while encircling you from behind. Houndeyes would hunt in packs with a leader, changing their behaviour and attack pattern based on the pack’s strength. Vortigaunts would retreat in fear but regroup in numbers, rallying in the safety of cover. Hardly any of these advances are even visible in games today, which are just upsetting to say the least.

Fourthly, the arsenal which Gordon can play with is very well designed, each gun has its own specific use and none of them are ever obsolete, just because you found a new shiny gun. Each section of the stages can be tackled with different weapons in different play styles. Sure they might not be perfectly balanced in multiplayer, but a community still exists to this day for its death matches, that should speak for the quality in itself.

If you have the fortune to play Half Life before, then I believe no amount of convincing is required. However, if you came from a newer generation of video game enthusiasts, you should give this title at least a single try in your lifetime. No regrets, Mr Freeman.

The decision to recommend this game or not is probably the most difficult I ever had on Steam.

I'm old enough to have seen severale decades of video gaming, I like very much science fiction and I do not dislike FPS if they have a good story to tell. For some strange coincidence I never tried HalfLife so far, I knew it was considered a master piece and I thought I would have played it sooner or later, untill almost 20 years later ...

The story is pretty simple. You start moving all the way in a secret base down to you laboratory, this trip makes you realize the huge size of the base. Something went wrong during an experiment, and aliens arrives on this side of the universe. Then it's time to  flee for your own sake, meeting and cooperating with other survivors on the road. Aliens are bad enough, then you are going to survive to the army, which isn't sent in to to help survivors, but to clean the mess.

The graphic is outdated, few skins for scientists and guards becoming soon repetitive. Acting voice and sounds are outdated too. During all the playtime I've been very engaged, I felt being a survivor running for my life, trying to help people along the road and find solutions fo move forward.
Control isn't good, there's always a feeling of slipping on ice and jumps are difficults.

I meant to finish it, but motion sickness moved in. I'm not able to play for more than 60 minutes before experiencing it and after several sessions I eventually quit. 

It's clear to me that this game was a masterpiece, it made history, but 20 years later it's not enjoyable anymore.
All in all I think you should try it, there's often the opportunity to get a good valve games bundle. This game has overwhelming positive reviews, and mostly all the negative are biased against valve for having quit the development of the line (which is a pity)

I'm looking forward to play BlackMesa and HalfLife2.

Em seu ano de laçamento em 1998 foi considerado o melhor FPS produzido até então, ganhando um grande carinho por todo o público e se tornou uma tendência de uma geração, contendo excelentes cenários, bem detalhados para sua época de criação, e uma história criativa capaz de ter nossa atenção por horas, contendo um grande Arsenal com muitas opções ao jogador, contendo até algumas opções inusitadas. Os efeitos sonoros de Half - Life contam com uma ótima qualidade tornando a experiência do jogo mais incrível.

Half Life, even today, remains a masterpiece of epic proportions. The graphics may be dated, but you'll be ignoring them the moment you get thrown into the combat, which is executed perfectly. You'll face a variety of enemies, from gun-toting U.S. Soldiers to aliens like headcrabs and vortigaunts. Luckily, you get a number of great weapons as you play on, like the powerful revolver or the smg with an attached grenade launcher. The ambiance is also amazing; you'll hear growls of hidden enemies as you pass through dimly-lit areas. A simply amazing experience that must be played.

Stop reading these reviews and just play the damn game!

You don't need a review, just as this game needs no external introduction. STOP READING AND BUY THIS GAME ALREADY.

Still here? Oh well, I might as well occupy you.

Yes, the graphics and sounds are dated, the artstyle isn't pretty. But this game is one of the most immersive experiences I have ever had. The story, despite being so simple, is expertly presented through the events of the game and really takes "Show, don't tell" philosphy to the next level.

I went into this game with high expectations based on it's hype and the fan obsession surrounding it. I was expecting to be dissappointed. But I was amazed. And for the first time in ages, I was also terrified. 

This game is almost too immersive. I felt as if I were genuinely running for my life at times. Like I was actually cornered and in danger. This game gives the feeling of zero hand holding, and you're almost immediately dropped in the deep end.

The only true downside I see with this game is the aspect ratio support. It only natively supports 4:3. selecting wider aspect ratios will simply cause the game to zoom in and slice-off the top and bottom, resulting in a SMALLER FOV.

But hey, I didn't care. I played this game in 4:3 the OG way, ON AN ULTRAWIDE MONITOR. Black bars be occupying most of my damn screen! So I think the majority of you will be fine. Or you could take the easy way out and play 'Black Mesa', which is just a remaster of this game running on the source engine.

Rating: *Give It A Try

*I personally won't be finishing the game especially when Black Mesa is a thing

H A L F L I F E 

I recommend this game to every single shooter lovers to see how the history began

Not to mention, like Half Life 2 and other Valve's, the games are always been on development hell and cut many things. Look for "MarphitimusBlackimus", the videos will show the many many cuts, such as Gordons' original death, the alphas and betas, and many interesting stuff. 
It is one of my top 10 favorite games of all time. 

PROS:

Storyline

Shooter + Puzzling - Yup, levels have shooting and puzzling which you have to move to the air vent and follow where it will lead to, and among others. With shooting, pure action too. This is what makes the game itself so unique, and so different from thousands of games. Even today, there are very very low games follow HL footsteps.

Excellent sounds. Everything about them is so unique and so good! Like the footsteps, medkit and armor charging sounds like DZZZZZZZKZZZZZZZZT, BD-D-D-DVZZZZT

Multiplayer. The multiplayer is very amazing. Best played with peanut butter jam sandwich. Great times. Also look for the videos of "The Gmen Squad!" by Xanatos, it makes you replay multiplayer again.

Personally the best game with unforgettable quotes. I swear, every quotes in this game is memorable.

The Whole Concept - The concept of aliens, sci fi things and more are gracious. My favorite of the whole concept is the HEV suit.

The Locations - Ever since I played the game I really want to travel to the USA and to view the beautiful deserts of New Mexico. This is probably one of the games that makes me want to see where they're bassed on. Catchy name though!

Mod support + calm community - There are so many great mods for this game. One of my favorites is the SSH: Mod Messup and Cry of Fear. 

Sound ambience and monsters are unique and just plain SCARY. Seriously at this point if you played Doom 3 (which is considered as horror game, and this game not) you’ll realize this is so much scarier than D3.

Expansion Packs are Amazing. I, F***ING LOVE, the idea to play the three (or 5, if Decay canon) characters with each of their perspectives of the Black Mesa disaster.
SO GOOD Soundtracks!!

Good story. And amazing one too, it's just not any other generic "the aliens have come to earth, defend earth and kill invaders" the plot is bit too deep, you can (i hate promoting but bare with me) check out "The Aftermath of the Black Mesa Incident" It's very interesting  

.... And more to write soon


CONS:

Not yet found

As of writing this I'm currently at the final boss. So in half life you play as Gordon Freeman an MIT graduate with a crowbar and the power to use it. Basically the gist is black mesa experimented with Portal technology and  guess what? monsters appear kinda like in some other game 'cough cough Doom cough' not that's a bad thing. The guns feel very powerful especially the Shotgun I feel like such a man when firing it you'll get other weapons of course such as experimental guns and Alien weapons and the obvious Colt M4 with a grenade launcher or mp5 depending on if you have the HD pack on or not.The environments are very cool you'll go from missile silos to a tram system to the cliffs of Black Mesa science facility to a strange alien world. The gore in this game is awesome when someone gets killed by an explosion your not going to just see blood but arms and legs and what's left of the guys head. Last but not least comes the soundtrack which is pretty awesome. Now should you buy this game uh yeah for 10 bucks you can't go wrong and this game is so old you can run it on a potato.

[b]Primera entrega del mítico FPS de Valve, donde se nos dio a conocer por primera vez al Dr. Gordon Freeman
¡El Mejor FPS De La Historia!
Y el titulo no es exagerado. Seremos Gordon Freeman en un día normal en el trabajo... Hasta que todo sale mal y abrimos paso a unos alienigenas hasta nuestro mundo. A partir de allí deberemos salir sanos y salvos del lugar combatiendo contra alienigenas y soldados (que intentan borrar todo rastro de lo ocurrido). Si bien Gordon no tiene la habilidad del habla (básicamente eso pienso hace 20 años) los personajes secundarios complementan bien la historia, logrando así un excelente argumento. La jugabilidad, gráficos y sonido marcaron un antes y un después en el mundo de los videojuegos. Actualmente no hay persona alguna que no haya jugado este titulo (o al menos escuchado de el) pero si eres parte de ese 0,0001% te invito a probar el mejor juego de la historia.[/b]
Great!
Es muy recomendable, me dieron hasta el Soundtrack... Valve siempre se ha lucido con Half Life... Ahora espero el 3 XD

Efsaneler hakkında ne söylenebilir ki? Daha önce 7 defa bitirdiğim oyundu. Son olarak steam kütüphaneme ekleyerek 8 oldu. İnanın yene aynı zevki ve heyecanı aldım. Anlatılamaz abi bu oyun. Hele 1980 ve 2000 arası doğumlu insanlar bu oyunun verdiği duyguyu iyi bilirler. Tavsiye alıp oynayın.

Half Life es un mega clásico, que desafortunadamente en su momento nunca lo jugue, sin embargo ahora que lo he terminado, sin duda es un excelente juego que ciertamente me causó nostalgia.

Este juego hizo recordar la franquicia Turok y Doom, juegos donde la dificultad impera, y habrá que necesitar de toda nuestra habilidad para acabar el juego, no sin mencionar que la durabilidad es un punto extra, ya que te puedes tardar bastantes horas en acabarlo intentandolo una y otra vez, sin duda clásicos juegos que ahora ya no los venden.

Recomiendo comprarlo si esta de oferta, ya que tiene muchos años, sin embargo vale bastante la pena tenerlo en tu biblioteca, ya que juegos como este ya son escasos. Lamentablemente no tiene logros ni cromos, pero el reto de poder acabarlo es satisfacción suficiente.

Самая первая игра в steam .

Die "Half-Life"-Spielreihe war vor einiger Zeit DAS Aushängeschild von Valve. Hierbei handelt es sich um das allererste Spiel der Reihe, welches im Oktober 1998 erschienen ist. "Half-Life" kann man vor allem in das Genre des Ego-Shooters einsortieren, allerdings besitzt das Spiel auch eine Vielzahl an Rätsel-/Puzzle-, Parcours-/Jump 'n Run-, als auch Adventure-Elementen. Da neben dem Erledigen von Gegnern, auch Hindernisse unter komplexe Situationen bewältigt, wie auch verschiedenste Rätsel gelöst werden müssen, um beispielsweise Türen zu öffnen oder Sprengfallen zu deaktivieren. Die Handlung, wie auch der Stiel von "Half-Life" ist sehr Science-Fiction basiert.

Der Protagonist und spielbare Charakter des Spiels ist hierbei Dr. Gordon Freeman, ein MIT-Physiker, der für die geheime Forschungseinrichtung namens "Black Mesa" arbeitet. Diese Forschungseinrichtung liegt  sehr weit abgeschieden in einer Wüste in dem US-Bundesstaat New Mexico und war ursprünglich eine Raketentestbasis. Dr. Freemans Spezialgebiet, wie auch die Abteilung in der er tätig ist, nennt sich "anomale Materie". Als das Experiment seiner geheimen Forschungsarbeit, zur Erschließung einer neuen Energiequelle durch Kristalle außerirdischen Herkunft jedoch misslingt, öffnen sich im gesamten Forschungsgebiet Dimensionstore aus der Parallelwelt "Xen", die sämtliche Kreaturen dieser Parallelwelt das Betreten in die "normale" Welt ermöglichen. Neben den außerirdischen Lebewesen, die Gordon Freeman konfrontieren, erscheinen in der Forschungseinrichtung U.S. Marines, die den Auftrag erteilt bekommen haben, jede Person und Kreatur zu erledigen, die das Gebiet verlassen will. Diese U.S. Marines haben wiederum die Situation unterschätzt und sind nicht in der Lage diese zu meistern, wodurch der Staat das "Black-Ops-Spezialkommando" losgerückt hat, mit dem Befehl die gesamte Forschungseinrichtung Black Mesa ausnahmslos samt allen Personen und Kreaturen auszulöschen. Gordon Freemans Ziel ist dabei aus dieser Einrichtung zu fliehen. Im gesamten Verlauf wird er allerdings unbewusst von einer mysteriösen Gestalt, der nur unter dem Namen "G-Man" bekannt ist, beobachtet.

FunFact: Der Titel des Spiels (Half-Life) ist eine Anspielung auf den Kernphysikalischen Fachbegriff "Halbwertszeit" Das klassische Symbol der Spielreihe ist dabei das "Lambda", welches auch als Zeichen für die Zerfallskonstante in der Physik verwendet wird.

Meine Persönliche Bewertung nach meinen Kriterien*:

Story 82,5 / 115
Gameplay 11,75 / 40
Grafik und Gestaltung 7 / 25
Sound 7 / 30
Atmosphäre 15 / 20
Sonstige Besonderheiten 10,25 / 20

*Bewertungen unterliegen hierbei zusätzlich (1) dem Vergleich zu neueren Spielteilen und (2) aus der Sicht der heutigen Zeit!


Ich werde mich bei meiner Bewertung sehr zurückhalten, da ich nicht in der Lage bin das Spiel verhältnismäßig zu bewerten. Wie man meiner Bewertung entnehmen kann, ist die Punktzahl besonders bei den Punkten: Gameplay, Grafik wie auch Sound recht negativ. Der Grund dafür ist einfach, dass ich das Spiel nur aus heutiger Sicht bewerten kann. Nicht falsch verstehen. Das Spiel wurde 1998 veröffentlicht. Es ist einfach älter als ICH. Dafür, dass "Half-Life" noch so eine gewaltige Playerbase, wie auch Fans besitzt, hat das Spiel meinen Respekt verdient. Für damalige Zeit war "Half-Life" bestimmt sehr revolutionär und was besonderes.

Aus diesem Grund werde ich nur einige Punkte kritisieren, die wirklich aus heutiger Sicht katastrophal gealtert sind.

Die Story von "Half-Life" fand ich sehr gut. Auch wenn die Handlung aus heutiger Sicht ein wenig generischer geworden ist, aber da will ich nicht meckern. Es gibt sehr viele Elemente die umgesetzt wurden, um die Handlung abwechslungsreich zu füllen. Allerdings ist die Gestaltung von den Orten zu sehr eintönig. Die gesamte Handlung spielt (mit Ausnahme von einigen Sequenzen auf Xen) in Black Mesa. Auch wenn die Map gigantisch groß ist (was "normaler" Spieler, die "Half-Life" nur einmalig durchspielen nicht wirklich bemerken) wurde meiner Meinung nach gestalterisch alles zu sehr gleich gehalten. Durch veraltete Grafik, hinterlässt es halt leider einen sehr schlechten Eindruck.

Ein weiterer Negativpunkt, welches nur in Deutschland exisiterte, ist die Indizierung von "Half-Life". Da damals die Jugendschutz-Standards hierzulande sehr streng waren, musste das Spiel stark angepasst werden, damit es überhaupt in Deutschland verkauft werden durfte. Leider hat es die Atmosphäre etwas geschadet, da "menschliche" Gegner wie die U.S. Marines durch Roboter ersetzt wurden, was wenig Sinn gemacht hat.
Friedliche NPC sterben auch nicht, sie setzen sich auf den Boden und schütteln den Kopf...
Mehr muss ich glaube ich nicht sagen. Auch wenn Valve nichts dafür kann, muss es trotzdem angesprochen werden. Denn meiner Meinung nach hätte man sich vielleicht eine bessere Lösung überlegen können, wie man den Beschuss auf (menschliche) Personen anderweitig zensieren kann.

Um das Gameplay angenehmer zu gestalten, empfehle ich allerdings den Spielern "Half-Life" auf 30 oder 60 FPS zu begrenzen, da das Spiel nicht ausgemacht ist mit hoher Framerate zu spielen. Als ich das Spiel damals 2016 das erste Mal gespielt habe, wollte ich einfach nur schnell "durchrushen" um direkt Half-Life 2 spielen zu können, da es sehr unangenehm war anzuschauen. Mir taten einfach die Augen weh und ich bekam leichte Übelkeitserscheinungen. Daher dauerte mein erster Durchlauf des Spiel auch mehrere Wochen bis Monate.
Abseits davon, waren die Mechaniken in dem Spiel echt revolutionär. Es gab schon damals eine große Auswahl von Waffen unterschiedlicher Art mit unterschiedlichen Funktionen und einem Sekundärfeuermodus.
Auch eine große Leistung, dass die Steuerung des Spielers und einige Objekte bis heute kaum verändert wurde.

Abschließend kann ich einfach nur erneut sagen, dass obwohl das Spiel nun mehr als 20 Jahre alt ist, dennoch empfehlenswert ist. Erwartet jedoch nicht extrem viel, da es logischerweise mit heutigen Spiele eher weniger mithalten kann, was es jedoch auch nicht muss. Genießt einfach die Handlung des Spiels!
